summary: This document is an email chain between FBI agents discussing a teleconference regarding the Epstein case, coordination with DOJ OPR, and Records Management Division contact information. It shows internal FBI communication about case coordination during the government shutdown period.

persons.name: Llompart, D.
persons.context: FBI agent from Miami field office involved in scheduling teleconference regarding Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein Case Teleconference
events.description: Conference call scheduled for FBI agents to discuss Epstein case, originally planned as in-person meeting but changed to teleconference due to government shutdown.

events.title: Epstein Case Teleconference
events.description: Conference call held at 11am with dial-in number and passcode provided for FBI agents to discuss Epstein case.

events.title: DOJ OPR File Review Request
events.description: DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility reached out to review Epstein case file, prompting request for Records Management Division contact information.

keyFacts: FBI agents from New York and Miami were coordinating a teleconference regarding the Epstein case in January 2019.
The government shutdown prevented New York FBI agents from traveling to Florida for in-person meetings about the Epstein case.
DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) requested to review the Epstein case file in early 2019.
The document shows internal FBI communication about case coordination between New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit and Miami field office.
